title: Memoirs of the life of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Lockhart, J. G.
snippet: Your Lordship cannot  but remember the Earl of Pembroke, in Edward the Sixth's time, expelling the nuns from Wilton — then in Queen Mary's reinducting them into their nunnery, himself meeting the abbess, barefooted and in sackcloth, in penance for his sacrilege — and finally, again turning the said abbess and her vassals adrift in the days of good Queen Bess, with the wholesome admonition — ' Go spin, you jades, go spin.'
